DOC.brief_summary: Main objective : To assess effect daily physical activity promotion pedometer 12 month apnea-hypopnea index ( AHI ) patient mild moderate obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) . Study patient . Subjects 30-80 year old diagnosis mild-moderate OSA ( AHI : 5-30 predominance obstructive event [ > 80 % ) ] . Design . Randomized , parallel open-label clinical trial , control conventional treatment . Intervention : Patients randomize ( 1:1 ) control group [ treatment follow-up accord conventional clinical practice ] intervention group [ addition conventional treatment follow-up , patient receive pedometer measure number step walk daily . Based cumulative step count day mean value since last visit , patient receive task increase step per day next appointment accord next protocol ( < 6000 steps/day : increase 3000 steps/day ; 6000 - 10000 steps/day : reach 10000 steps/day ; > 10000 steps/day : maintain increase step ) . Measurements . At , 12 , 24 52 week randomization , follow determination make : anthropometric characteristic ; clinical evaluation ( smoke history , sleep symptom , comorbidities , current medication ) ; questionnaire ( ESS , FOSQ , SF-12 , EuroQoL iPAZ ) ; heart rate blood pressure ; analytical determination ( HbA1c , HOMA index , cholesterol , LDL-cholesterol , HDL-cholesterol , triglyceride , homocysteine , NT-proBNP hsCRP ) ; plasmatic biomarkers ( 8-isoprostane , IL1beta , IL6 , IL8 TNFalpha ) ; evaluation daily physical activity use accelerometer .
